intro: Echinops fraudator, commonly known as the false globe thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiky, spherical seed heads that resemble those of true thistles. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are gray-green and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellowish. Echinops fraudator is often used in ornamental gardening due to its architectural appearance and drought tolerance.
